chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Marlene A. Cleveland was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Marlene A. Cleveland was found guilty of Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample, unless already provided.  No entry into bars, tavern, liquor stores or any business where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  No operation of a MV w/out valid DL and agent's approval.  Absolute sobriety at all times.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marlene A. Cleveland in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner.  Defendant Marlene A. Cleveland in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  Parties rec/rev PSI and are ready to proceed.  Atty Gardner points out a couple of errors in PSI.  State notes victim was noticed but didn't want to be involved.  Atty Gardner has no one who wants to make a statement prior to sentencing.  State makes her recommendation.  Atty Gardner responds/makes his recommendations.  Letter from treatment center in Michigan provided to the Court.  DE makes brief statement.  Court sentences.  DE advised re: felony firearms warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.

Ct 1:
4 years prison (2 years Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision)
Fine/costs of $1794.00 and $25.00 blood draw fees to be paid per agent during extended supervision
Revoke DL and IID for 36 months
AODA
Conditions of Extended supervision:
DNA sample to be provided
Not to go to bars/taverns/liquor stores or any business who's primary purpose is selling alcohol
Not to own/operate MV w/o valid DL and agent's approval
Absolute sobriety at all times
181 days sentence credit
DE is eligible for ERP

Ct 3:
Probation for 2 years consecutive to extended supervision in Ct 1
Conditions of probation:
AODA/Counseling/Treatment per agent
Absolute sobriety at all times
Not to go to bars/taverns/liquor stores or any business who's primary purpose is selling alcohol
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid per agent
DNA sample to be provided

Defendant Marlene A. Cleveland in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner.  Defendant Marlene A. Cleveland in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Count 1 and Count 3.  State moves to dismiss Count 2.  Dismiss/read in Count 4.  Dismiss TR matter.  Jointly requesting PSI.  Attorney Gardner agrees.  No contest to Count 1 & 3.  Defendant agrees.  Court goes through constitutional rights.  Plea accepted.  PSI ordered and due to court by July 10, 2015.

Defendant Marlene A. Cleveland in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner.  Defendant Marlene A. Cleveland in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Schedule a plea hearing and order PSI.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on June 1, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.    Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial Br. 1.  Bond continues.

Defendant Marlene A. Cleveland in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner.  Defendant Marlene A. Cleveland in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State and Attorney advise of waiver today.  Defendant agrees and understands.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.
Preliminary hearing on February 20, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Marlene A. Cleveland in court.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin w/Deputy Heimann from SCSD.  Court states case and appearances.  State notes he spoke to the DE and she states she has an attorney Gardner from Wis Rapids but he couldn't be here today.  DE agrees w/statement by the State.  Says Atty Gardner couldn't be here as he had to be out of state.  Court will not proceed w/hearing today as DE has counsel.  Court finds good cause to extend the time limits for prelim.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Marlene A. Cleveland appeared by video means with Attorney Middleton. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not yet applied.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request $3000.00 cash bond.  Defendant is currently employed.  Request signature bond.  No warrant history.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits not waived. $3000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:    Not to oper MV, absolute sobriety at all times, no taverns or liquor stores, may not possess any alcohol and must submit chemical testing by law enforcement.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.
